Submodules¶

forest.bonsai.simulate_gps_data module¶

Module to simulate realistic GPS trajectories of a number of people anywhere in the world.

class forest.bonsai.simulate_gps_data.Action(action: forest.bonsai.simulate_gps_data.ActionType, destination_coordinates: Tuple[float, float], duration: List[float], preferred_exit: str)¶

Bases: object

Class containing potential actions for a Person.

Parameters

  • action – ActionType, indicating pause, pause for the night or flight-pause-flight

  • destination_coordinates – tuple, destination’s coordinates

  • duration – list, contains [minimum, maximum] duration of pause in seconds

  • preferred_exit – str, exit code

duration: List[float]¶
preferred_exit: str¶

class forest.bonsai.simulate_gps_data.Person(home_coordinates: Tuple[float, float], attributes: forest.bonsai.simulate_gps_data.Attributes, local_places: Dict[str, list])¶

Bases: object

This class represents a person whose trajectories we want to simulate

calculate_trip(origin: Tuple[float, float], destination: Tuple[float, float], api_key: str) → Tuple[numpy.ndarray, forest.bonsai.simulate_gps_data.Vehicle]¶

This function uses the openrouteservice api to produce the path from person’s house to destination and back.

Parameters

  • destination – tuple, coordinates for destination

  • origin – tuple, coordinates for origin

  • api_key – str, openrouteservice api key

Returns

2d numpy array, containing [lat,lon]

of route from origin to destination

transport: Vehicle, means of transport

Return type

path

Raises

RuntimeError – An error when openrouteservice does not return coordinates of route as expected after 3 tries

choose_action(current_time: float, day_of_week: int, update: bool = True) → forest.bonsai.simulate_gps_data.Action¶

This function decides action for person to take.

Parameters

  • current_time – int, current time in seconds

  • day_of_week – int, day of the week

  • update – bool, to update preferences and office day

Returns

Action dataclass

choose_preferred_exit(current_time: float, update: bool = True) → Tuple[str, Tuple[float, float]]¶

This function samples through the possible actions for the person, depending on his attributes and the time.

Parameters

  • current_time – float, current time in seconds

  • update – boolean, to update preferrences

Returns

str, selected action to perform tuple, selected location’s coordinates

Return type

tuple of string and tuple

end_of_day_reset()¶

Reset preferred exits of the day. To run when a day ends

This function updates the set of preferred exits for the day, after an action has been performed.

Parameters

exit_code – str, representing the action which was performed.

forest.bonsai.simulate_gps_data.bounding_box(center: Tuple[float, float], radius: int) → Tuple¶

A bounding box around a set of coordinates.

Parameters

  • center – set of coordinates (floats) (lat, lon)

  • radius – radius in meters of area around coordinates

Returns

tuple of 4 elements that represents a bounding box around the coordinates provided

forest.bonsai.simulate_gps_data.gen_all_traj(person: forest.bonsai.simulate_gps_data.Person, switches: Dict[str, int], start_date: datetime.date, end_date: datetime.date, api_key: str) → Tuple[numpy.ndarray, List[int], List[float]]¶

Generates trajectories for a single person.

Parameters

  • switches – (dictionary) contains changes of attributes in between the simulation

  • address (all amenities around the house) –

  • start_date – (datetime.date object) start date of trajectories

  • end_date – (datetime.date object) end date of trajectories, end date is not included in the trajectories

  • api_key – (str) api key for open route service

Returns

(numpy.ndarray) contains the gps trajectories of a single person, first column is time, second column is lattitude

and third column is longitude

home_time_list: (list) contains the time spent

at home each day in seconds

total_d_list: (list) contains the total distance

travelled each day in meters

Return type

traj

Raises

  • ValueError – if possible destinations around the house address are less than 4

  • ValueError – if no offices around person’s house address

forest.bonsai.simulate_gps_data.gen_basic_pause(location_start: Tuple[float, float], time_start: float, t_e_range: Optional[List[float]], t_diff_range: Optional[List[float]]) → numpy.ndarray¶

This function generates basic trajectories for a pause.

Parameters

  • location_start – tuple, coordinates of pause location

  • time_start – float, starting time

  • t_e_range – list, limits of ending time (None if t_diff_range used)

  • t_diff_range – list, limits of duration (None if t_e_range used)

Returns

numpy.ndarray, containing the trajectories

Raises

  • ValueError – if both t_e_range and t_diff_range are None

  • ValueError – if t_e_range is not None and does not have 2 elements

  • ValueError – if t_diff_range is not None and does not have 2 elements

forest.bonsai.simulate_gps_data.gen_basic_traj(location_start: Tuple[float, float], location_end: Tuple[float, float], vehicle: forest.bonsai.simulate_gps_data.Vehicle, time_start: float) → Tuple[numpy.ndarray, float]¶

This function generates basic trajectories between 2 points.

Parameters

  • location_start – tuple, coordinates of start point

  • location_end – tuple, coordinates of end point

  • vehicle – Vehicle, means of transportation,

  • time_start – float, starting time

Returns

numpy.ndarray, containing the trajectories float, total distance travelled

forest.bonsai.simulate_gps_data.gen_route_traj(route: list, vehicle: forest.bonsai.simulate_gps_data.Vehicle, time_start: float) → Tuple[numpy.ndarray, float]¶

This function generates basic trajectories between multiple points.

Parameters

  • route – list, contains coordinates of multiple locations

  • vehicle – Vehicle, means of transportation,

  • time_start – float, starting time

Returns

numpy.ndarray, containing the trajectories float, total distance travelled

forest.bonsai.simulate_gps_data.generate_addresses(country: str, city: str) → numpy.ndarray¶

Generates multiple addresses.

Parameters

  • country – (str) country of the persons

  • city – (str) city of the persons

Returns

(np.ndarray) contains address coordinates of each person

Return type

addresses

Raises

  • RuntimeError – if the api raises error for too many tries

  • ValueError – if the api returns no results

forest.bonsai.simulate_gps_data.generate_nodes(house_address: Tuple[float, float], employment: forest.bonsai.simulate_gps_data.Occupation) → Dict[str, List[Tuple[float, float]]]¶

Generates multiple amenities coordinates.

  • employment – (Occupation) occupation of the person

Returns

(dictionary) contains coordinates of each amenity

forest.bonsai.simulate_gps_data.get_basic_path(path: numpy.ndarray, transport: forest.bonsai.simulate_gps_data.Vehicle) → numpy.ndarray¶

Subsets paths depending on transport for optimisation.

This function takes a path from get_path() function and subsets it to a specific number of nodes. :param path: 2d numpy array :param transport: Vehicle

Returns

subset of original path that represents the flight

forest.bonsai.simulate_gps_data.get_path(start: Tuple[float, float], end: Tuple[float, float], transport: forest.bonsai.simulate_gps_data.Vehicle, api_key: str) → Tuple[numpy.ndarray, float]¶

Calculates paths between sets of coordinates

This function takes 2 sets of coordinates and a mean of transport and using the openroute api calculates the set of nodes to traverse from location1 to location2 along with the duration and distance of the flight. :param start: coordinates of start point (lat, lon) :param end: coordinates of end point (lat, lon) :param transport: means of transportation, :param api_key: api key collected from

https://openrouteservice.org/dev/#/home

Returns

2d numpy array containing [lat,lon] of route distance: distance of trip in meters

Return type

path_coordinates

Raises

RuntimeError – An error when openrouteservice does not have any remaining quota

forest.bonsai.simulate_gps_data.gps_to_csv(data: pandas.core.frame.DataFrame, path: str, start_date: datetime.date, end_date: datetime.date) → None¶

Writes gps trajectories to csv files.

Parameters

  • data – (pandas.DataFrame) contains gps trajectories for each person

  • path – (str) path to save csv files

  • start_date – (datetime.date) start date of trajectories

  • end_date – (datetime.date) end date of trajectories,

(dictionary) contains attributes of each person,

loaded from json file.

switches: (dictionary) contains possible changes of attributes

in between of simulation

Prepares the data in a dataframe.

Parameters

  • timestamp_s – (int) timestamp of starting day

  • tz_str – (str) timezone

Returns

(pandas.DataFrame) final dataframe of simulated gps data.

new

forest.bonsai.simulate_gps_data.process_switches(attributes: Dict[str, Dict], key: str) → Dict[str, int]¶

Preprocesses the attributes of each person.

Parameters

  • attributes – (dictionary) contains attributes of each person, loaded from json file.

  • key – (str) a key from attributes.keys()

Returns

(dictionary) contains possible changes of attributes

in between of simulation

Return type

switches

forest.bonsai.simulate_gps_data.remove_data(full_data: numpy.ndarray, cycle: int, percentage: float, day: int) → numpy.ndarray¶

Only keeps observed data from simulated trajectories depending on cycle and percentage.

Parameters

  • full_data – (numpy.ndarray) contains the complete trajectories

  • cycle – (int) on_period + off_period of observations, in minutes

  • percentage – (float) off_period/cycle, in between 0 and 1

  • day – (int) number of days in full_data

Returns

(numpy.ndarray) contains the trajectories of the on period.

Return type

obs_data

forest.bonsai.simulate_gps_data.sim_gps_data(n_persons: int, location: str, start_date: datetime.date, end_date: datetime.date, cycle: int, percentage: float, api_key: str, attributes_dict: Optional[Dict[str, Dict]] = None) → pandas.core.frame.DataFrame¶

Generates gps trajectories.

Parameters

  • n_persons – (int) number of people to simulate

  • location – (str) indicating country and city to simulate at, format “Country_2_letter_ISO_code/City_Name”

  • start_date – (datetime.date) start date of trajectories

  • end_date – (datetime.date) end date of trajectories, end date is not included in the trajectories

  • cycle – (int) the sum of on-cycle and off_cycle, unit is minute

  • percentage – (float) the missing rate, in other words, the proportion of off_cycle, should be within [0,1]

  • api_key – (str), api key for open route service https://openrouteservice.org/

  • attributes_dict – (dictionary) containing attributes for each user, optional

Returns

(pandas.DataFrame) contains gps trajectories

for each person

Return type

gps_data

Raises

  • ValueError – if attributes.json is not in the correct format

  • ValueError – if location is not in the correct format

  • RuntimeError – if too many Overpass queries are made

  • ValueError – if Overpass query fails
